text: First ’ll create four simple UIs. can ignore specifics UIs now, might want come back see work run app. real scenes app, shiny::tagList() UI UI function. ’ll use actions decide UIs display.
code: # ui1 loads if none of the requirements are met. ui1 <- shiny::tagList(   shiny::p("This is UI 1."),   shiny::a("Add '?code' to the URL to see UI 2.", href = "?code") )  # ui2 allows us to create the cookie requirement for ui3. ui2 <- cookies::add_cookie_handlers(   shiny::tagList(     shiny::p("This is UI 2."),     shiny::actionButton("cookie_simple", "Store Simple Cookie"),     shiny::p("Press the button to see UI 3.")   ) )  # ui3 allows us to update that cookie to one that will pass validation. ui3 <- cookies::add_cookie_handlers(   shiny::tagList(     shiny::p("This is UI 3."),     shiny::actionButton("cookie_valid", "Store Valid Cookie"),     shiny::p("Press the button to see UI 4.")   ) )  # ui4 only loads when everything is all set. It has a button to reset things. ui4 <- cookies::add_cookie_handlers(   shiny::tagList(     shiny::p("This is UI 4."),     shiny::actionButton("reset", "Reset"),     shiny::p("Press the button to go back to UI 2.")   ) )

title: Changing scenes
text: scenes, shiny_scene associates UI one scene_actions used choose . case, ’ll display UIs four situations: Display ui4 user particular cookie set value cookie successfully passes validation function. Display ui3 user cookie set, value doesn’t validate. Display ui2 user particular parameter URL query string. Display ui1 none cases true. real app, final UI likely login screen, perhaps error page. toy example, cookies “valid” certain value. value changes sometimes, create validation function accepts cookie value acceptable value. wrap ui4 req_has_cookie() action, shiny_scene. shiny_scene ui3 similar, skip validation. words, must cookie set, don’t care value . ui2, ’re looking parameter named “code”. don’t care value (, ’d pass vector acceptable values). Finally, set scene without actions fall-UI.
code: our_cookie_validator <- function(cookie_value, acceptable) {   cookie_value == acceptable } scene4 <- set_scene(   ui4,   req_has_cookie(     cookie_name = "our_cookie",     validation_fn = our_cookie_validator,     acceptable = "good value" # We can pass variables through to our validator.   ) ) scene3 <- set_scene(   ui3,   req_has_cookie(     cookie_name = "our_cookie"   ) ) scene2 <- set_scene(   ui2,   req_has_query("code") ) scene1 <- set_scene(   ui1 )

title: Changing scenes
text: wrap scenes together change_scene(). list scenes priority order. can use ui just like shiny UI.
code: ui <- change_scene(   scene4,   scene3,   scene2,   scene1 ) # Any UI that the user sees will use this # shared server backend. server <- function(input, output, session) {   # If they press the button in ui2, save a cookie and reload.   shiny::observeEvent(     input$cookie_simple,     {       cookies::set_cookie("our_cookie", "bad value")       session$reload()     }   )      # If they press the button in ui3, save a "valid" cookie and reload.   shiny::observeEvent(     input$cookie_valid,     {       cookies::set_cookie("our_cookie", "good value")       session$reload()     }   )      # If they press the reset button in ui4, delete the cookie and reload.   shiny::observeEvent(     input$reset,     {       cookies::remove_cookie("our_cookie")       session$reload()     }   ) }  shiny::shinyApp(   ui = ui,   server = server )

text: can see demonstration {scenes} . examples might use {scenes} switch different UIs Shiny app: Login Wrapper: Use {scenes} switch login page main content app. original use case {scenes}. ws designed abstract login-wrapper concept implemented {shinyslack}. App Modes: Use {scenes} switch different modes app, view-mode edit mode, via query parameter (yourapp.shinyapps.io?mode=edit). User Roles: Use {scenes} switch different UIs based user roles. example, non-admin user might see different UI admin user. Login Wrapper example might look like : See {shinyslack} fully implemented example.
code: library(shiny) library(scenes)  # Define the different scenes for the app login_ui <- fluidPage(   textInput("username", "Username"),   passwordInput("password", "Password"),   actionButton("login", "Login") )  main_ui <- fluidPage(   h1("Welcome"),   textOutput("username") )  # Use the `set_scene()` function to define the different scenes, and # `change_scene()` to switch between them. ui <- change_scene(   set_scene(     main_ui,     req_has_cookie(       "validate_login",       validation_fn = my_validation_fn     )   ),   fall_through = login_ui )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   observeEvent(input$login, {     use_cookies_package_to_save_cookie_fn(input$username, input$password)   })    output$username <- renderText({     input$username   }) }  shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
